reviews.review_msg: Great prof with interesting research interest on migration and media. enjoyed and recommend for those who enjoy theory

Dr. Yin is fantastic as a lecturer. She does not put any unnecessary burden on students. Furthermore, her lectures are elementary to understand. She makes the concepts clear. She also records her lectures. The course materials are exciting. She is also really caring. Highly recommend her class. She has peer-reviewed journal articles.

Dr. Yin is a fantastic professor. She does not put unnecessary course load. The topics are fascinating, and she makes the lectures easy to understand alongside the slides. Dr. Yin also records the lectures. She makes excellent points to discuss, and her exams are lenient because she does not ask anything outside the lectures. Highly recommend.
She is chill and very nice. She is passionate about her course. Would recommend!

Literally the worst teacher I have ever had in my 4 years at SFU.  I had to 'unlearn' how to write a good paper. a paper with a thesis is a bad thing for him.  I hope you like negative feedback, because every time he hands back an assignment he spends half an hour of class time tell everyone how terrible they ALL were! Good Riddance.

Scott's course was a challenge, no doubt, but it was equally rewarding. Scott clearly really cares about his students' learning (he stated this explicitly multiple times), and to that end he let us write multiple drafts of our papers before receiving a final grade on them - I wish every class allowed this.

He expects you to be enthusiastic about his class, but he hates teaching so it makes it difficult to want to try.  His lectures do not correspond to his readings. His accent is very difficult to understand. He knows the material well, but often reads from his notes like he's reading from an essay (boring lectures). Marking is fair.

Scott will go to great lengths to help you if you show interest in his class. Sometimes the material can be a bit confusing or go over your head but the more you talk about it the easier it is to understand.

Shan seemed interested in the lecture content, however was focused too much on getting students to participate in lecture. Even though there was a tutorial component to the class, she insisted on asking questions and waiting silently until someone answered, but then shut them down. Half of the lectures were questions and painful awkward silences.

Course needs focus, due to a personal story style that makes learning useful content challenging. Vague course outline makes writing the term papers difficult. Not the best or a useful communication course for anything productive.

Rick has an uncanny ability to explain difficult concepts and make you understand why they are important to communications. He has a breadth of knowledge that can be intimidating, but he's actually very approachable. My favorite prof in communications.
Rick is excellent. Lectures are extremely interesting and he is always ready for extra help. I took the course in the fall and have never received so much help from a Prof. Great Job Rick :)

Rick is excellent. Lectures are extremely interesting and he is always ready for extra help. I took the course in the fall and have never received so much help from a Prof. Great Job Rick :) Thanks a ton.
Rick will give you extra help when you go to his office hour. He would like to give you many interesting examples to help you understanding concepts. He is a very nice professor!

Rick does a great job at explaining very complex ideas. If you attend class every week, you will do well on the papers. The course covers crucial concepts that will bring value to the knowledge of someone majoring in communications.
I like the way he teaches by using stories to clarify difficult concepts and theories. He's also very approachable and he'll give you lots of help if you ask. Good prof.

Thoroughly enjoyed his lectures, though they were long and sometimes rambling.  The material is dense and very theoretical, but his lectures are entertaining even when the material isn't.  Fair marker, though the papers were all long, expect to write no less than 10 pages per paper for him, no shorter papers at all.
Amazing lecturer, but the material is really difficult. You have to be really into history and theory to like his classes. But for theory heads Gruneau is the Man!

He is a good at lecturing but goes off topic and its confusing. The subjects in this class is BORING. You will most likely fall asleep or get lost and if you look around half the class will be lost too.
loved his lectures. he is a great storyteller  and great educator. i cant get enough of his lectures.

Gruneau is a great guy and an entertaining and hilarious storyteller.  I love the way he teaches, it is so refreshing to just listen to a prof rather than try to listen and read a bunch of notes at the same time.  He is a very GOOD marker, which means that he can tell how much effort you actually put into something.

Excellent prof! Here's a prof who doesn't use those flashy PowerPoint lecture notes, just plain old chalk and board, a cup of coffee, and a REAL PASSION FOR TEACHING! He has this amazing ability to explain very complex and nuanced concepts in an entertaining way. Highly recommended!
My second course with him. Best prof I've had in 4 years at SFU. Brilliant, really funny at times and a fantastic lecturer.
